Intervention.evidence: These included 3-minute tidal volume breathing and 8 vital capacity breaths, with and without oxygen flowing through the nasal cannula as an adjunct.

Objective.evidence: Objective: To observe the benefits of oxygen through nasal cannula when used as an adjunct during preoxygenation.

Method_Outcome.evidence: end-tidal O 2 (ETO 2 ) was recorded at the end of each test.

Result_Outcome.evidence: When comparing the efficacy of the two preoxygenation methods, we found that the addition of oxygen through the nasal cannula improved the efficacy of preoxygenation with both the 3-minute tidal volume breathing method and the 8 vital capacity method ( p < 0.001).
